questions.title: Complete find_last Function
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens into the blanks to complete the find_last function that finds the last node with a matching key:
questions.explanation: We initialize r to NULL to track the last matching node. We traverse the list while node is not NULL, check if the current node's key matches k, and update r when we find a match. Finally, we return r which points to the last matching node (or NULL if none found).
hints: Initialize r to NULL since we haven't found any matches yet
Use != to check if node is not NULL
Use -> to access struct members through a pointer
Update r to point to the current node when keys match

questions.title: Complete While Loop
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to complete a while loop that sums numbers from 1 to n:
questions.explanation: Initialize sum to 0, start i at 1, loop while i <= n, add i to sum each iteration, and increment i by 1.

questions.title: Find Max in Array
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to complete a function that finds the maximum element in an array:
questions.explanation: Initialize max with arr[0], then scan from i=1 to n-1. If a larger element is found, update max. Return max at the end.
hints: Start max with the first element
Update max when a bigger value appears

questions.title: Swap with Pointers
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to complete a swap function using pointers:
questions.explanation: Use a temporary variable to store *a, assign *a = *b, and then assign *b = tmp.
hints: Use a temp variable to avoid losing a value

questions.title: Sum Array
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to complete a function that sums an array:
questions.explanation: Initialize sum to 0, loop from i=0 to n-1, add each element to sum, and return it.

questions.title: String Length Loop
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to complete a string length function:
questions.explanation: Start at index 0 and increment until the null terminator is reached.

questions.title: Even Check
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to complete an even check:
questions.explanation: A number is even when x % 2 equals 0.

questions.title: Factorial Loop
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to complete a factorial loop:
questions.explanation: Start result at 1 and multiply by each i from 1 to n.

questions.title: Second Element
questions.description: Drag the correct token to return the second element:
questions.explanation: arr + 1 points to the second element, and dereferencing yields its value.
hints: arr + 1 points to the second element

questions.title: Reverse Print
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to print an array in reverse:
questions.explanation: Start at the last index n-1, print while i >= 0, and decrement.

questions.title: Allocate Int Array
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to allocate an int array:
questions.explanation: Use malloc with n * sizeof(int), and return NULL if allocation fails.

questions.title: Count Positives
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to count positive values:
questions.explanation: Increment count when the element is greater than 0.

questions.title: Copy String
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to copy a string:
questions.explanation: Copy characters until the null terminator, then append a null terminator to the destination.

questions.title: Find First Match
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to return the first matching index:
questions.explanation: Return the index when a match is found; otherwise return -1.

questions.title: Pointer Advance
questions.description: Drag the correct tokens to advance a pointer by one element:
questions.explanation: Dereference p to access the pointer it points to, then add 1 to move to the next element.
hints: Use *p to access the pointer value

questions.title: Complete Pointer Swap Function
questions.description: Drag tokens to complete a function that swaps two integers using pointers:
questions.explanation: To swap values through pointers: parameters are pointers (int *a), dereference to access values (*a), store in temp, swap dereferenced values.
hints: Parameters must be pointers to modify caller's variables
Use * to dereference and access the actual values

questions.title: Complete Array Sum Function
questions.description: Drag tokens to complete a function that sums array elements:
questions.explanation: Array sum: array parameter with [], initialize sum to 0, loop from 0 to size-1, use += to accumulate.

questions.title: Complete String Length Function
questions.description: Drag tokens to complete a function that calculates string length:
questions.explanation: String length: iterate through characters until null terminator '\0', count characters, increment len.

questions.title: Complete Memory Allocation Function
questions.description: Drag tokens to complete safe memory allocation:
questions.explanation: Safe malloc: allocate size * sizeof(type) bytes, check if returned NULL (allocation failed), return NULL on failure.

questions.title: Complete Struct Initialization
questions.description: Drag tokens to initialize and access a struct:
questions.explanation: Struct pointer: parameter is pointer (*p), use arrow operator (->) to access members through pointer, += to modify values.

questions.title: Complete Power Function (Recursive)
questions.description: Drag tokens to complete recursive power function:
questions.explanation: Recursive power: base case is exp == 0 returns 1, recursive case is base * power(base, exp-1).
hints: Base case: any number to power 0 is 1

questions.title: Complete Linked List Insert at Head
questions.description: Drag tokens to insert a node at the head of a linked list:
questions.explanation: Insert at head: pointer to pointer (node_t**) to modify head, allocate new node, set data, point new_node->next to current head, update head to new_node.
hints: Double pointer (**) needed to modify head
New node points to old head

questions.title: Complete File Reading Code
questions.description: Drag tokens to complete file reading:
questions.explanation: File reading: fopen with "r" for read, check for NULL, fgets reads lines while != NULL, fclose closes file.
hints: fgets returns NULL at end of file

questions.title: Complete Bit Manipulation
questions.description: Drag tokens to complete bit operations:
questions.explanation: Bit operations: AND (&) with mask to check bit, left shift (<<) to create mask, OR (|) to set bit.

questions.title: Complete Ternary Operator
questions.description: Drag tokens to complete ternary operations:
questions.explanation: Ternary operator: condition ? true_value : false_value. Compact if-else alternative.
hints: Max: if a > b return a, else b
Abs: if x >= 0 return x, else -x
